name: Philadelphia County
note: Philadelphia is a consolidated city-county (Philadelphia County merged with City of Philadelphia)

municipal.name: Philadelphia Municipal Court - Traffic Division
municipal.address: 1401 John F. Kennedy Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19102
municipal.parking: Various paid parking lots and meters in Center City
municipal.publicTransport: SEPTA Market-Frankford Line to 15th Street Station

trafficDivision.name: Traffic Division Window
trafficDivision.note: Handles traffic citation payments and scheduling

commonPleas.name: Court of Common Pleas of Philadelphia County
commonPleas.note: Appeals from Municipal Court traffic cases

publicDefender.note: Available for indigent defendants in criminal traffic cases

clerk.name: First Judicial District Clerk of Courts

contestingTicket.deadline: Must respond by court date on citation
process: Plead not guilty by mailing ticket with collateral or appearing in person
Bring all evidence and witnesses to hearing

courtDates.continuances: Request must be made in writing before hearing date
courtDates.noShow: Failure to appear results in default judgment and possible license suspension

diversionProgram.note: Philadelphia does not offer traditional traffic diversion programs

trafficSchool.available: Only by court order after conviction
trafficSchool.note: Not available as part of plea bargain in PA

localRules.dressCode: Business casual; no shorts, tank tops, hats, or flip-flops
localRules.electronics: Cell phones must be silenced; no recording devices
localRules.checkIn: Arrive 30 minutes early to clear security

specialConsiderations.redLightCameras: Civil violations only - does not add points

locations: SEPTA parking lots at suburban stations
parking.note: Center City parking is expensive; consider public transit

publicTransit.routes: Market-Frankford Line, Broad Street Line, Regional Rail
